snippet: Small-market teams tried to put into effect a rule that would inhibit big-market teams from spending large sums on prospective Japanese stars like the ace pitcher Masahiro Tanaka.
abstract: Last-minute dispute places the new posting system for Japanese players in jeopardy; small-market teams in Major League Baseball are trying to put rule into effect that would inhibit big-market teams, particularly the New York Yankees, from spending large sums on prospective Japanese stars like ace pitcher Masahiro Tanaka.
lead_paragraph: Small-market teams tried to put into effect a rule that would inhibit big-market teams from spending large sums on prospective Japanese stars like the ace pitcher Masahiro Tanaka.

headline.main: Dispute Jeopardizes New Posting System for Japanese Players
headline.print_headline: Dispute Jeopardizes New Posting System for Japanese Players
